climbs.name: Idiot Savant
climbs.fa: D Brayshaw, C Campbell, C Fleet 1998

content.description:
On the right hand side of This Is Your Brain. Start up a ramp just right of Mad Science. Thin cracks (nuts and small cams) lead to a bolt and a right trending ramp. Move up the ramp past a horn and a potential #3 camalot placement to a short wall with thin holds and two bolts. Climb a featured face above past a horn and a perfect hand crack to a ledge below a roof. Move out over the roof and up past three more bolts, then climb past thin cracks (nuts and blue/yellow TCUs) to the top. On the right side of This Is Your Brain.

Descend as per Mad Science. 6 bolts and gear from blue TCU to #3 Camalot. Two solid horns can be slung as well (not exactly necessary, but done on the FA). Often done just with the bolts and three or four cams, but this is pretty sporty, with up to 8m between pieces.

Scramble up low-angle rock (3rd class) to a ledge below the route and a possible gear belay. Begin up a right-facing layback corner that turns into straight in jamming (gear to 3.5"). Where the crack dies out, move right onto a featured face, traversing past one bolt, then up a line of holds past four more bolts. The last bolt below the top has a hangerless bolt next to it (old station). The actual station is on chains just over the lip. The opening and finishing moves are cruxy while much of the intermediate climbing is easier with several good rests. On the left side of This Is Your Brain.

IMPORTANT NOTE: the rappel from the top chains is about 61m. A 60m rope barely makes it down if you rappel. Because of the zigzag in the climb, though, if you try and lower off the top and don't unclip, your rope will come up short! Three or four cams from finger size to #3 or 3.5 camalot, plus 5 bolts

The central line of the crag. Scramble up a few meters on a ramp to belay. The opening moves traverse hard left past a bolt into a round scoop. Climb out of the scoop up thin cracks (yellow and blue TCUs) then make laybacky moves on flake holds past several more bolts to gain a big fault (optional #4 camalot in the fault). Continue up a slabbier face to the top.

40m rappel to get down. Also possible to rap from the Jugular Vein anchor or scramble down a trail in a gully on the north end of the crag back to the base.
9 or 10 bolts, blue and yellow TCUs (possible orange TCU as well), possible #4 Camalot.
Large vertical to slabby crag at the summit of the Rehabs, to the right of Ripple Tower
